dialogueLines: Okay, first of all — who puts salt and sugar on popcorn?
You said it would be ‘experimental.’ Yeah, well, it was an experiment in disaster.
And don’t think I didn’t notice you fell asleep halfway through the movie!
I was crying during the sad scene, and you were literally snoring next to me.
You promised to make better popcorn next time — I’m holding you to that, mister.
Also, how do you forget the ending? It’s the one where the dog saves the day! You had one job!
Still... it was kind of cute watching you drool on the couch. Kind of.

questions.questionText: What did I say you mixed on the popcorn?
questions.correctResponse: Right! Salt and sugar — your ‘experimental’ disaster.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said you mixed salt and sugar, not that!

questions.questionText: What did I catch you doing during the movie?
questions.correctResponse: Correct! You were totally sleeping while I was crying!
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said you fell asleep during the movie!

questions.questionText: What did I say about the sad scene?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! I was crying — unlike someone who was busy snoring.
questions.wrongResponse: Nope! I said I was crying during that scene!

questions.questionText: What did you promise for next time?
questions.correctResponse: Right! You promised to make better popcorn next time.
questions.wrongResponse: No… you didn’t promise snacks, just better popcorn.

questions.questionText: What did I say was kind of cute?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! You drooling on the couch — adorable in a tragic way.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said it was cute watching you drool on the couch!
